Uses of Interface
net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence.Equivalence

Packages that use Equivalence
net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence This package contains the Equivalence interface central to the library, as well as some of the basic implementations used when creating equivalences from annotation-driven specification interfaces. 
net.chwthewke.hamcrest.matchers This package exposes the implementation entry point Equivalences which has methods to create Equivalences from equivalence specifications. 
 

Uses of Equivalence in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence
 

Classes in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence that implement Equivalence
 class ApproximateEqualityEquivalence
          The EqualityEquivalence class defines equivalence on anynumeric type as close equality up to a given tolerance.
 class EqualityEquivalence<U>
          The EqualityEquivalence class defines equivalence as equality by equals().
 class IdentityEquivalence<U>
          The IdentityEquivalence class defines equivalence as equality by ==.
 class IterableEquivalence<T>
          IterableEquivalence is an equivalence that acts upon Iterables of a type given an equivalence on the component type.
 class LiftedEquivalence<T,U>
          LiftedEquivalence allows to extend an equivalence acting upon a type U to anoter type T using a function of T into U.
 class NullAwareEquivalence<T>

<T> Equivalence<T[]>
ArrayEquivalences.arrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super T> equivalence, boolean inOrder)
          Adapts an equivalence on T into an equivalence on T[].

static Equivalence<short[]> ArrayEquivalences.shortArrayEquivalence(Equivalence<? super Short> equivalence, boolean inOrder)
          Adapts an equivalence on Short into an equivalence on short[].
static Equivalence<String> TextEquivalence.textEquivalenceWith(TextEquivalenceOption... options)
          Creates an Equivalence acting on Strings, that is by default like EqualityEquivalence, but can be relaxed by a number of options among the following: IGNORE_CASE makes the equivalence ignore case.

Constructors in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence with parameters of type Equivalence
IterableEquivalence(Equivalence<? super T> equivalence, boolean inOrder)
          Creates an equivalence such that two Iterables are equivalent iff there exists a 1-to-1 mapping between their respective elements such that each pair of elements in the mapping are equivalent.
LiftedEquivalence(String name, Equivalence<? super U> equivalence, com.google.common.base.Function<T,U> projection)
          Creates an equivalence that considers t1 and t2 to be equivalent iff projection.apply( t1 ) and projection.apply( t2 ) are equivalent according to the argument equivalence.
 

Uses of Equivalence in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.matchers
 

Methods in net.chwthewke.hamcrest.matchers that return Equivalence

<T> Equivalence<T>
Equivalences.asSpecifiedBy(Class<?> equivalenceSpecification, Class<T> matchedType)
          Creates an Equivalence from the equivalence specification equivalenceSpecification.
static
<U,T extends U>
Equivalence<U>
Equivalences.asSpecifiedBy(Class<?> equivalenceSpecification, Class<T> matchedType, Class<U> equivalenceType)
          Creates an Equivalence from the equivalence specification equivalenceSpecification.
static
<T> Equivalence<T>
Equivalences.asSpecifiedBy(Class<? extends EquivalenceSpecification<T>> equivalenceSpecification)
